content.description: Start up easy slab which gets progressively harder then pull a fun roof and finish up more slab.
content.location:
The bolted line on the right side of the canyon across from

Three Kings

.

content.description: Fun, easy warmup with easy climbing down low, a dihedral crux, then easy slab up top.
content.location: This route is on the right side of the lower tier, about 20 feet left and around the corner from Welcome to Frustration.

climbs.name: Rubble Roulette
climbs.fa: Chris Miller and Greg Sidberry, February 2021

content.description:
Easy terrain leads to the base of a headwall where tricky movement in a shallow corner gains a featured roof and fun moves pulling onto the finishing slab.

The name stems from a rockfall encounter earlier in the day on the other side of the canyon.
content.protection:
Top-rope from anchors on

Welcome to Frustration
content.location:
Located to the right of

Frustration Bypass

.

content.description: This is an easy third class toprope that is great for letting little kids have their first climbing experience.  The crux is getting off the ground (now that they have dug the ground down about five feet from where it used to be), and it continues up the easy slab to a two bolt anchor.
content.protection: Third class it up to the two bolt anchor at the top of the slab to set up a TR.
content.location:
This route goes up the prominent slab just to the right of

Welcome to Frustration

.

content.description: Fun route or free solo to the right of the waterfall. Also a good approach if your too scared to solo the normal way up
content.location:
Right of the waterfall, around and left of

Welcome to Frustration

.

climbs.name: Frustration Bypass
climbs.fa: Chris Miller and Greg Sidberry, February 2021

content.description:
Climb

Welcome to Frustration

midway and then move right along a slabby arête to a fun and interesting topout.
content.protection:
Top-rope from anchors on

Welcome to Frustration
content.location:
Same start as

Welcome to Frustration

and branch right at the 4th bolt of that route.

content.description: Route just to the left of Double Scoop.  Crux is pulling the ledge on small handholds, throw a foot and go for it.  It is well protected as are most routes here.
content.location: Midway up the right side, there's a grouping of three routes right next to each other all to different but close anchors.  Ground layout is in flux after a recent slide.

content.description: Interesting route with two cruxes, first pulling the bulge down low and second getting over the roof.  Well protected, although the hangers are hard to see from the ground.  Can be made easier if you go right at the roof.
content.location: Right side of the lower tier, 5 feet to the left of Shwoopy Doo. Look for the bulge down low and roof towards the top.
